title: How to Make a Derby Fizz

steps.headline: Fill a cocktail shaker 1/2 to 3/4 full with ice.
Add 3/4 to 1 1/2 oz Scotch whisky to the shaker.
steps.description: Measure out the Scotch whisky with a jigger cup or free pour. Use greater amounts if a more prominent Scotch whisky flavor is desired. If a high-quality Scotch is used, it should be complemented by the other ingredients, but not overwhelmed.

steps.headline: Add 1 to 3 tsp orange liqueur to the shaker.
steps.description: Use greater amounts if a more prominent orange flavor is desired. More orange liqueur will also result in a sweeter drink, as liqueur has a high sugar content.

steps.headline: Add a whole egg to the shaker.
steps.description: Use a pasteurized shell egg or egg product to eliminate the chance of becoming infected with salmonella bacteria.

steps.headline: Add 1/2 to 1 teaspoon sugar to the shaker.
Add 1 to 3 teaspoons lemon juice to the shaker.
Cap the shaker and shake vigorously for about 5 seconds.
steps.description: For more details, see How to Make a Shaken Cocktail.

steps.headline: Strain into a tall glass that has been filled with ice.
Top off with soda water.
steps.description: Pour slowly, as the drink may foam up too much and overflow.

steps.headline: Stir gently to mix the ingredients and serve the drink.

Use greater amounts if a more prominent Scotch whisky flavor is desired. If a high-quality Scotch is used, it should be complemented by the other ingredients, but not overwhelmed. Add 1 to 3 tsp orange liqueur to the shaker. Use greater amounts if a more prominent orange flavor is desired. More orange liqueur will also result in a sweeter drink, as liqueur has a high sugar content. Add a whole egg to the shaker. Use a pasteurized shell egg or egg product to eliminate the chance of becoming infected with salmonella bacteria. Add 1/2 to 1 teaspoon sugar to the shaker.  Add 1 to 3 teaspoons lemon juice to the shaker.  Cap the shaker and shake vigorously for about 5 seconds. For more details, see How to Make a Shaken Cocktail. Strain into a tall glass that has been filled with ice.  Top off with soda water. Pour slowly, as the drink may foam up too much and overflow. Stir gently to mix the ingredients and serve the drink.
